abstracts.cdata!:
This environmental assessment for the
            RISP details negative environmental impacts and measures to
            mitigate them. High standard phytosanitary requirements ,
            adequate packaging, and compliance with bilateral agreements
            will ensure that pests and diseases and diseased animals and
            animal products will not be introduced in export. Staff will
            be trained in proper handling methods, appropriate storage
            of fuels and lubricants, and periodic safe transfer to
            recycling facilities will reduce soil contamination and
            water pollution. Safety equipment and clothing will be
            issued and on-site warnings given to avoid personal
            injuries. Loss of aquatic ecosystems and resources will be
            prevented by appropriately handling and storing pesticides,
            fertilizers, and waste materials. Also, farmers will be
            trained in appropriate application levels. And the
            timeliness of applications. The importance of the ecosystem
            from where irrigated water will be sourced will reduce the
            loss of water systems through irrigation. Traditional plant
            varieties and indigenous and endemic germplasm will be
            protected. Crop rotation with legumes and green manures will
            avert heavy dependence on fertilizers. There will likely be
            some nutrient leaching from chemicals into surface waters
            and into groundwater sources as well as nutrient enrichment
            of the soil. Effective air emission controls will be deployed.
